data.title: Klay: ‚ÄúI‚Äôve got to lead. I‚Äôve got to use my voice‚Äù (is music to my ears especially with Steph Curry out)
data.text:
Klay Thompson stating in the postgame that he‚Äôs been asked by Steve Kerr and assistant coach Bruce ‚ÄúQ‚Äù Fraser to be more vocal and evolve his game a la Michael Jordan going down to the block or Magic Johnson developing a three-point shot later in their careers is music to my ears, especially in the absence of Steph Curry.

In the first minute of the second half, Thompson made another behind-the-back pass that went nowhere, leading to a fast break for the Houston Rockets. It was the second time in 24 hours he had done that, committing the exact same AAU-level turnover at Crypto.com Arena the night before against the LA Lakers.

In that moment of the Rockets game, pulled from the notes of the livestream below, here was my criticism of Klay as I watched the Golden State Warriors unravel yet again at the start of the second half at Chase Center: ‚ÄúIs it a cultural thing with Steph‚Äôs carelessness?‚Äù (We all know that the behind-the-back pass turnover is a Curry-type turnover.)

Shortly thereafter, Kerr called a timeout at the 8:25 mark and I lit into Klay: ‚ÄúNo leadership on the floor, Klay taking bad shots, but made one of them ‚Ä¶ People want to blame Kerr for not adjusting, where's the blame for Klay for not adjusting? You can't keep playing as if Steph is on the floor when he's not, you make a mistake with Curry around, he can make up for it, but when he's not around then there's more risk. In a perfect world, Klay would play more unselfishly, stop dribbling so much, stop with the early shots ‚Äî same criticisms for Jordan Poole ‚Äî but then again, it's hard to change suddenly, because your whole career you've played alongside Steph. Tonight we're getting away with it because Houston really is that bad.‚Äù Note: the Warriors still led at that point and went on to win decisively behind an eventual 12 threes from Thompson, waking up from that usual halftime trance.

So when Klay took the podium and said he was asked to be more of a leader, I threw my hands up (literally, you can see it on the livestream) and exclaimed, ‚ÄúHallelujah!‚Äù

Now, I don‚Äôt know exactly in the game when he tried to be a leader, but that‚Äôs not the point. The point is, despite that turnover and some rushed shots which by the way are different scenarios than the late shot-clock, desperation splash which ignited his hot hand, he‚Äôs got leadership on his mind. It‚Äôs the inception that I‚Äôm looking for, not necessarily the result. A journey of a thousand steps begins with one.

‚ÄúI just try to use my voice tonight. I try to be loud on defense. I try to be encouraging on the bench,‚Äù Thompson told reporters. ‚ÄúThis year I‚Äôd be in my own feelings, because I wasn‚Äôt shooting the ball well or I didn‚Äôt feel like myself‚Ä¶

I‚Äôve been here so long. I‚Äôve got to lead. I‚Äôve got to use my voice. It was a great challenge for me tonight. I thought I took a good step.‚Äù

There was also the reference to the Geno Auriemma Instagram Reel, which we on the livestream and eventually in the comments of our YouTube channel found kind of funny (that he was inspired by Instagram).

Anyways, it‚Äôs music to my ears that Klay is aware he has to lead these guys in the absence of Steph, but also with Draymond Green questionable with that right knee contusion. Let‚Äôs hope, now that he‚Äôs verbalized it, there‚Äôs no more behind-the-back swing passes into the hands of the opponent, and a renewed commitment to the ‚ÄúTiki-taka‚Äù unselfish style of cutting and passing.

That was my main takeaway from the Rockets win, although I do have a lot to say about the people throwing Kerr under the bus for not playing Patrick Baldwin, Jr. earlier in the season (when the rotation was shortened!). I would just ask fans to avoid the addiction to outrage and merely celebrate PBJ‚Äôs ascension. Hindsight is always 20/20, but analysis of that hindsight improves your vision for the future. There are reasons why the young guys stopped playing early after the 0-5 road trip and chief among them is the subpar performance of the Foundational Six. I‚Äôm sure we‚Äôll get into that, eventually.

My takeaway from the loss at the Lakers was disappointment in the lack of execution, although the absence of Andrew Wiggins ‚Äî who, by the way, deserves privacy for his ‚Äúpersonal matter‚Äù ‚Äî certainly was a factor against a more athletic LeBron James-led foe. And then Steve took the podium and alluded to that, saying that they‚Äôll just ‚Äúkeep coaching‚Äù.

At that point I did wonder if perhaps the team had started to tune him out. But this season has been rife with complications, one domino after the next. In any case, if the team has begun to tune him out, that‚Äôs not necessarily his fault and I‚Äôm sure the staff is aware of all the problems this season and will adjust accordingly for their programs of future seasons. I think it would be a mistake to dismiss Kerr‚Äôs program and culture, and install a new one. But, as I said, we‚Äôll get into that on this website at some point, I‚Äôm sure.

Below are the detailed notes, quotes and video from the Rockets and Lakers games, in the usual reverse chronological order. I didn‚Äôt think I‚Äôd get around to this but it turns out the latest video I‚Äôm uploading is having serious issues, so here I am filling in some time as technology works itself out. This, unfortunately, will cause delays in the behind-the-scenes Warriors-Rockets video from Chase Center. All the raw footage for that is ready to go.

Hope to see you on the livestream tonight. Come see why people have actually become addicted to our positivity (I have screenshots of live chat comments to prove it)‚Ä¶

DISCLAIMER: These are all just notes for my main workflow of YouTube videos, mostly transcribed by me shortly after the interviews and during my coverage of postgame on our livestreams (!). Sometimes I‚Äôll just use what‚Äôs tweeted by beatwriters, as listed. The links to the tweets are not available because sometimes I don‚Äôt use the full tweet and just having a ton of tweets on this website imo isn‚Äôt aesthetically pleasing and gets away from the main goal: transferring information (not so much entertainment) to the brains of DubNation asap.

‚Ä¢ Klay Thompson postgame on getting back to form: ‚ÄúIncredibly gratifying‚Ä¶ always reflect on the years I was not playing‚Ä¶ weird time and now it‚Äôs easy to put everything into perspective and appreciate nights like this‚Ä¶ play with great pace‚Ä¶ not even hesitate or think about anything‚Ä¶ give our performance staff credit.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On not shooting twos: ‚Äúgetting good looks from beyond the perimeter we‚Ä¶ I had the hot hand‚Ä¶ it felt great I can‚Äôt lie to y‚Äôall.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On why he always is hot against the Rockets: ‚ÄúThey‚Äôre a young team‚Ä¶ I just think it‚Äôs coincidence.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On being asked to have more leadership: ‚ÄúI just try to use my voice tonight. I try to be loud on defense. I try to be encouraging on the bench. I actually saw a great video of (University of Connecticut Women‚Äôs Head Basketball Coach) Geno Auriemma talking about his players, and how he might not let the girls get in if they don‚Äôt show great body language, and how he watches game film and he observes his players if they are engaging on the bench, and if they‚Äôre being a great teammate, and that resonated with me a lot. This year I‚Äôd be in my own feelings, because I wasn‚Äôt shooting the ball well or I didn‚Äôt feel like myself, and after hearing that you know, Geno‚Äôs been around so much greatness I just reminded myself to be a leader. I‚Äôve been here so long. I‚Äôve got to lead. I‚Äôve got to use my voice. It was a great challenged for me tonight. I thought I took a good step.‚Äù (Warriors PR)

‚Ä¢ On where he saw the Auriemma video: ‚ÄúI saw that on an Instagram Reel this afternoon and it was really great‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm not the most comfortable using my voice but you‚Äôve got to be comfortable being uncomfortable.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On when the conversations about rebounding happen: ‚ÄúSteve and Bruce Fraser, Q‚Ä¶ used Michael Jordan as an example‚Ä¶ mid-30s‚Ä¶ low-post‚Ä¶ not saying I‚Äôm Mike‚Ä¶ Q told me I‚Äôm gonna go down as one of the greatest shooters ever‚Ä¶ go for triple-doubles and round out my whole game‚Ä¶ they‚Äôre straight shooters‚Ä¶ they wouldn‚Äôt tell me those things if I wasn‚Äôt capable.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On when he had the conversation with Q and Kerr about evolving: ‚ÄúI had that conversation with Q last week and me and Steve‚Ä¶ this afternoon.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On pushing Poole aside on the technical foul shot: ‚ÄúI told Jordan when he gets to my colossal age he can have my seniority, he said that was a bad excuse but that‚Äôs how the cookie crumbles‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm gonna keep continuing to do that. Sorry young fella.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On if he‚Äôs at his pre-injury or his old self: ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt like to talk about vintage me or am I my old self‚Ä¶ I was capable of these things in the past. As long as my wrists still work, my feet still work‚Ä¶ hunting great shots.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On if he‚Äôs watching his percentage from 3 and 2: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm aware of it because I take my job serious‚Ä¶ efficient rate but it doesn‚Äôt make or break me‚Ä¶ high volume hit efficient scorer but who doesn‚Äôt, but I would like to improve.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ Donte DiVincenzo postgame recap on Klay: ‚Äúwhen he gets it going, feed the hot hand.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On 26 threes, one shy of franchise record: ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt know that‚Ä¶ third quarter took a few tough threes. Once we started touching the paint‚Ä¶ adjustment‚Ä¶ two feet in the paint, kick out, swing swing.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On PBJ: ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs confident. It‚Äôs not easy to be a rookie and be thrown in randomly‚Ä¶ not easy to do especially when you‚Äôre not playing consistently‚Ä¶ to have that mental strength‚Ä¶ much needed and much appreciated.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ Ty Jerome postgame on Klay‚Äôs threes: ‚ÄúOh, man. That‚Äôs kind of who he is. I don‚Äôt think anybody on the team is really surprised when he does that. No matter if he‚Äôs coming off a bad game or a good game, he‚Äôs always capable of that. That‚Äôs who he‚Äôs been his whole career. Four championships, Hall of Famer, and multiple All-Star for that reason because he‚Äôs one of the greatest shooters ever.‚Äù (GSW PR)

‚Ä¢ On the other threes: ‚ÄúHow many did Donte (DiVincenzo) hit? Five? And Klay hit 12? He (Patrick Baldwin Jr.) was great tonight too, but he‚Äôs been great all season. What is he shooting from three? 46, 45 (percent)? That‚Äôs crazy. Especially for him and he never knows when he‚Äôs going to play. He comes in the game at random times he's always locked and loaded and shooting at a really high clip. That's super impressive for a guy his age as well.‚Äù (GSW PR)

‚Ä¢ On if he knew they were close to breaking the franchise record for threes in a game: ‚ÄúNo way. Damn, no, I didn‚Äôt know that. If I knew that I would‚Äôve shot some at the end.‚Äù (GSW PR)

‚Ä¢ On if he‚Äôs thinking about his two-way status: ‚ÄúHonestly, not at all. I'm obviously far from satisfied, you know, as a team we have a lot of ground to make up and we're heading into a super important part of our season, but individually this year, you know, I've gotten an unreal platform, so I'm really not thinking too far ahead. I'm just taking it one game at a time. I'm enjoying myself. I‚Äôm playing on a team this year that we're fighting for a playoff spot. Just that piece alone, just doing what I can and really enjoying that part.‚Äù (GSW PR)

‚Ä¢ On his good assist-to-turnover ratio: ‚ÄúJust who I am as a player. It‚Äôs who I've always been as a player, I had two today though. Just taking care of the ball especially when you're the backup point guard. That's your job. We have guys on this team that are more aggressive and they're going to have a few more turnovers and I got to be the kind of guy that‚Äôs kind of stabilizing us.‚Äù (GSW PR)

‚Ä¢ On PBJ staying ready: ‚ÄúHe's super mature for a guy his age. He's like I said, every time he's up here with us, he never knows if he's going to play. He comes in and you know what you're going to get from him. Like that's super impressive for a rookie let alone what is he 18, or 19? For a 19-year-old rookie to know what you are going to get from him is super impressive to be like reliable. He‚Äôs shooting the crap out of the ball. I kind of just, you know, I don‚Äôt have to tell him much.‚Äù (GSW PR)

‚Ä¢ Patrick Baldwin, Jr. postgame in-studio on being back at Chase: ‚Äúalways great to get back here, get with the big club‚Ä¶ Klay had his big night, everybody contributed.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On other aspects of the game: ‚ÄúBuilding all around the game, in the paint, defensively‚Ä¶ three-level scorer.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On getting through the trade deadline: ‚ÄúMy agent told me just stay level-headed‚Ä¶ every year it‚Äôs gonna come up, there‚Äôs gonna be rumored‚Ä¶ does wonders for a player‚Äôs confidence (getting past it).‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On being ready for read-and-react: ‚ÄúJust comes with being a coach‚Äôs son‚Ä¶ Chris Collins‚Ä¶ Brian James.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On how hard it is to get through social media: ‚ÄúI have a great backbone and a great family‚Ä¶ inner circle‚Ä¶ would‚Äôve known there was a great challenge ahead of me.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On going down to SCW and coming up: ‚ÄúTo me, it‚Äôs just more basketball. I just wanna play basketball 24/7‚Ä¶ get proper sleep‚Ä¶ an added challenge to myself.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On what it‚Äôs like not having Steph: ‚ÄúThe mood of the team is great. We know we have enough‚Ä¶ gotta watch out for that wounded dog‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs gonna fight and we‚Äôre gonna fight.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On adding the PB&J: ‚Äúif we‚Äôre at home‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm more of a raspberry.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On being part of Steph Klay Dray: ‚Äúto be able to get to that level takes a lot of work.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On moving without the basketball: ‚Äúcreates more offense and opportunity‚Ä¶ Steph has shown throughout his career and so has Klay‚Ä¶ make sure your teammates are engaged.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On wearing the Air Force 1s: ‚Äúdefinitely stepped the game up.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ Steve Kerr postgame on Klay: ‚Äúbrilliant tonight‚Ä¶ at the point where he can do this‚Ä¶ second back to back‚Ä¶ that night we limited him to 25 minutes‚Ä¶ his rebounding was a factor, his defense and playing 35 minutes second night of a back to back.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On his many threes: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs Klay, so yes‚Ä¶ I like the midrange for Klay because he‚Äôs a great shooter‚Ä¶ gonna have to hit from time to time‚Ä¶ if the threes are there we‚Äôd rather have that but depending what the defense is doing‚Ä¶ we need our best shooters shooting from the midrange because it‚Äôs often the best shot we‚Äôre gonna get.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On if Klay had a minutes restriction: ‚ÄúThere really wasn‚Äôt a minutes restriction‚Ä¶ all-star break.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On if PBJ was expected to be part of the rotation: ‚ÄúYeah. When Draymond went out, Baldwin was automatically elevated into the rotation.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On Draymond: ‚ÄúI thought he was gonna play but he was pretty sore‚Ä¶ clearly the right decision. He‚Äôs been playing night after night‚Ä¶ we have tomorrow off and he should be ready to go Sunday.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On PBJ: ‚ÄúPatrick has been getting better and better‚Ä¶ lot of time in the G League‚Ä¶ I was thrilled just to see the other areas in the game. He had great verticality at the rim‚Ä¶ thwarted a layup‚Ä¶ used his size‚Ä¶ really good prospect‚Ä¶ game kinda clicks when he‚Äôs out there. The ball moves‚Ä¶ but he‚Äôs a young guy and he has a lot to learn‚Ä¶ on a great path.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On PBJ playing at the 5: ‚ÄúI would say he‚Äôs more of a 4 where he could slide down to the 3‚Ä¶ I look at him more as a 3-4 playing with Draymond, with Loon, potentially both of them‚Ä¶ spaces the floor.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On Moody: ‚Äúcompeted and played well.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On Kuminga midrange: ‚ÄúWe like for JK to really attack the rim‚Ä¶ he‚Äôs got that pump fake‚Ä¶ turnaround ten-footer‚Ä¶ coming along well.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On Looney with 13+ boards in five straight games: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs who he is now. He‚Äôs one of the elite rebounders per minute in the game. I‚Äôm so happy for Loon because of the work he‚Äôs put in to get himself healthy‚Ä¶ learned a lot from Andre Iguodala‚Ä¶ I took the coaching staff, Loon is the most mature person in the organization including the coaches‚Ä¶ there‚Äôs no drama‚Ä¶ when we take him out he understands we‚Äôre just taking him out. It‚Äôs a joy to coach Kevon‚Ä¶ we‚Äôd be in huge trouble without him‚Ä¶ incredible rock he‚Äôs been over the years.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On Klay flourishing: ‚Äú7 rebounds. We are challenging him to get on the glass. It‚Äôs part of his evolution‚Ä¶ every great player as they get older, they have to evolve‚Ä¶ Michael Jordan, it meant going down to the block‚Ä¶ Magic‚Ä¶ became a great three-point shooter‚Ä¶ and just expect to be the same player five years later‚Ä¶ better defensively and more vocal‚Ä¶ within the team he‚Äôs now the elder‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm excited about. I can see Klay starting to figure that out.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ Coach Stephen Silas postgame on the Warriors: ‚ÄúWhen you play this team you have to be on it when it comes to your game plan. And often times it takes playing this team year after year, game after game, where you‚Äôre familiar with it. But our guys are so young that they‚Äôre not familiar with the little nuances and actions that they run for Klay to get those shots.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ Klay Thompson on-court postgame after Fitz joked that he looked tired: ‚ÄúFitz a comedian now, I love it.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On his 12 threes: ‚ÄúYou usually see Steph and JP doing it‚Ä¶ sometimes I gotta throw it back to my Wazzu and Santa Margarita days. I can get my bag open‚Ä¶ rhythm dribble‚Ä¶ let it fly.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On Andrew Bogut tweeting him during the game: ‚ÄúBogues, man. Woah, don‚Äôt shirt change me‚Ä¶ I wanted to get that 12 so bad‚Ä¶ Steph‚Ä¶ he got all the three-point records‚Ä¶ our young fella stepped up‚Ä¶ PBJ‚Ä¶ shout out to the squad, we‚Äôre doing it together.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On trying to get to the FT line: ‚ÄúI did not start the game the way I wanted to‚Ä¶ always gets you into good rhythm.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On the homestand; ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs extremely vital‚Ä¶ we have to treat every game like a must-win‚Ä¶ better shape‚Ä¶ our synergy is getting better‚Ä¶ we owe the Timberwolves one.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On tonight‚Äôs game: ‚ÄúI enjoyed that.‚Äù

0:00 no Draymond Green, Andrew Wiggins or Stephen Curry

11:30 tipoff!

16:00 8min39 Q1 Kerr timeout as it takes Donte 9 seconds to start the offense and Steve looks livid

17:15 James Warner comments about Myers and Dray: it's hard to predict what Dray will do, but also I've said this before, Joe Lacob, Bob, Steve, Steph, Klay Thompson and Dray need to get in a room and hash out the future

20:00 7min39 on the rebound, Klay could get better with dribbling this off-season

20:45 Dean Agan: "GSW average age tonight is 25"

24:00 Warner: "Klay has moved up to 2nd in the NBA in 3PM"

24:30 if Dray had to miss a game, let it be this one

25:15 one more thing with Jordan Poole: his role has changed again, he has got to be more aware that his mistakes are going to have a bigger impact on us

27:00 4min45 Looney is awesome: rebound and lead pass to JK

28:00 4min30 Sengun "shoves" Loon on reb, Loon too tired to complain to ref

30:30 Warner says he's had Klay's Achilles and it does not affect offense, only defense

33:30 Steph no more Abe Lincoln beard

34:00 Vitor: "Lamb is a two-way, can't expect him to have 4 good months in a row"

36:15 on playing PBJ: 1) Moody should get the chance first, 2) Kerr did say on the radio today that sometimes when things are stagnant you do have to search for a combination that works

37:00 Moody came in for the last play of Q1

38:30 Derwin Gaston: "I think Moody should run the point like in Summer League" -- is there time to implement that?

40:00 I just think that journalists should give reasons and not complain like fans, Steve has implemented a championship system that hasn't been knocked off yet officially, it revolves around Steph and that's why it's hard to adjust on the fly especially when Curry is out

48:15 PBJ checked in for Lamb, the five are Ty Jerome, Klay Moody, JaMychal

54:00 6min21 Moody loses Jabari Smith on POA, they just don't teach shuttle drill anymore, we analyze the video

58:00 4min45 HUGE MOMENT: Sengun doubles JP leaving PBJ wide open, maybe you think about having PBJ and JP on the floor at the same time

1:05:00 this unit of Donte, Klay, JP, Lamb and JK is producing results!

1:06:45 Lamb is essentially the de facto Draymond tonight, in terms of pace

1:24:00 Klay awful turnover in the first minute of second half, second one in two games, is it a cultural thing with Steph's carelessness? The other thing is Kerr gets thrown under the bus and not Klay

1:32:00 8min25 timeout with no leadership on the floor, Klay taking bad shots but made one of them

1:33:00 you want to blame Kerr for not adjusting, where's the blame for Klay for not adjusting, because you can't keep playing as if Steph is on the floor when he's not, you make a mistake with Curry around, he can make up for it, but when he's not around then there's more risk. In a perfect world, Klay would play more unselfishly, stop dribbling so much, stop with the early shots -- same criticisms for JP -- but then again, it's hard to change suddenly, because your whole career you've played alongside Steph. Tonight we're getting away with it because Houston really is that bad

1:46:15 let's say Jacque Vaughn gets Kevin Durant traded away, or earlier this season, KD got injured. Does Vaughn suddenly implement read-and-react offense? Why doesn't he get blamed for not adjusting in KD's absence? Why does Kerr get blamed for not adjusting in Steph's absence? (even though he is doing micro-adjustments)

1:48:30 1min50 PBJ random bad screen is why he doesn't get more minutes

1:49:30 1min05 PBJ catch and shoot 3, maybe 3 is better than -2

1:53:45 analyzing Lamb last play of Q3 where he helped Moody, this is why I like him in terms of building off that defensive instinct

2:20:00 KLAY POSTGAME ON-COURT AUDIO (blocked by YouTube later)

2:29:30 Klay needs 12 more 3s to tie Paul Pierce

2:30:30 Jay Capinia: "After seeing PBJ play, Warriors is the team for light-skinned shooters"

2:35:30 Klay joins Steph as 2nd player ever with 8 seasons of 200+ threes, now 863 behind Ray Allen

2:40:00 would GP2 come off the bench? I think it's matchup-based, so if we need to stop somebody, then it depends, but yeah if I had to guess, I'd guess he comes off the bench

2:42:00 DEAN JOINS US

2:44:00 KERR POSTGAME AUDIO, LATER KLAY, DONTE

3:08:00 Looney reminds Warner of Udonis Haslem

3:09:30 GSW is 4-0 when Klay scores 40+ this season

‚Ä¢ Andrew Wiggins remains out tonight against the Rockets due to personal reasons. Draymond Green is questionable with a right knee contusion. Banged it during the second half last night. Houston will be without Jalen Green and Kevin Porter Jr. (Anthony Slater)

‚Ä¢ Opening statement from Steve Kerr at Rockets pregame: ‚ÄúI want to start by, I don‚Äôt know if you are aware that Raymond's (Ridder) sister Kathy passed away and so Raymond is not here today. He's at the service. I want to start by offering our condolences to Raymond and his family. I think you guys all feel the same way as we do about Raymond, what an incredible person he is and what an amazing ambassador he is for the Warriors, and what he means to us. So today is a sad day for Raymond and his family and by extension a sad day for us as well. So, knowing Raymond, he's probably watching the press conference to make sure I don't screw up, but Raymond, we're thinking about you and the whole family.

‚Ä¢ ‚ÄúOn a basketball note, I want to congratulate Jim Boylen and Team USA for qualifying for the World Cup. It's been a process. Jim and his staff have coached 52 different players over the last year or so in multiple competitions to get to this point. Two of our G League players, Dusty Hannahs, and Eli Pemberton are playing right now in the qualifiers. So 52 different American players who are all aspiring pros, who are trying to get their careers going, have contributed to USA basketball and helping us qualify for the World Cup. And Jim Boylen has done a great job with that whole group and they all go unheralded. I just want to take the time to say thank you as, as the coach of the team that will be playing the World Cup this summer, my gratitude goes out to Jim and all the players.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ Draymond Green upgraded to probable for tonight. He went through the walk through and will warmup. Kerr is hopeful that Draymond will play tonight: ‚ÄúI think he'll play." Draymond went through walkthrough and is going to warmup. (Madeline Kenney, Dalton Johnson)

‚Ä¢ No additional details on Andrew Wiggins‚Äô absence. Kerr: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs too difficult to know, to tell. So, again with just to respecting his privacy, I think I'm not going to talk anything about it. It's just when he's ready to come back, he'll come back.‚Äù Away from the team for a third straight game. (Anthony Slater)m, GSW PR)

‚Ä¢ On Kuminga‚Äôs shot selection: ‚ÄúWe talked about it at practice a couple of days ago and there was a play late in last night's game where we moved it four or five times and then he got the corner three and he knocked it down. That's the one we want. And this is part of being a young player. Knowing when to shoot, when to pass, and when to dribble and it sounds so simple it's just not. The game's fast, the defenses are all over the place everything is happening so quickly and it just takes reps. What I've talked to JK about is if you come down and you‚Äôre wide open immediately, move it. DHO, cut to the basket, get the ball swung and it comes back to you then you shoot that one, but you have to make the defense work before you just launch because there's a strategy going on. There's the game within the game. That's a shot they want him to take. So let's make them work first and get a little flow, make them have to navigate what our offense is doing, and maybe they make a mistake. And then there's usually a better rhythm if the ball moves a few times before you shoot as well.‚Äù (GSW PR)

‚Ä¢ ‚ÄúI'm going to play Moses tonight‚Ä¶ Moses, he reminds me a lot of Loon. Incredibly mature, hard-working.‚Äù Says he has played great lately and continues to praise his maturity and work ethic. (Dalton Johnson)

‚Ä¢ On Patrick Baldwin Jr: ‚ÄúI see a future rotation player.‚Äù (CJ Holmes)

‚Ä¢ On Steph Curry, who is currently going through an on-court workout with Rick Celebrini on the Warriors‚Äô practice court: ‚ÄúThings are coming along well. All good signs.‚Äù (Dalton Johnson)

0:30 ‚Ä¢ Darvin Ham postgame on the Lakers defense: ‚Äúthey play fast‚Ä¶ great win against a great ball club.‚Äù

6:00 ‚Ä¢ On the third quarter: ‚Äúgetting stops‚Ä¶ trying to guard those guys, Klay, Jordan. You just imagine when Steph gets back out there and Wiggs, they have a helluva ball club. Just come out with a focus, not to relax‚Ä¶ stay aggressive‚Ä¶ move the ball.‚Äù

9:40 ‚Ä¢ Anthony Davis postgame on their playoff chances: ‚ÄúTonight was a challenge‚Ä¶ even though they don‚Äôt have Steph there still a good basketball team with Jordan, Draymond, Klay.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ Klay Thompson postgame: ‚Äúour perimeter defense wasn‚Äôt great, allowed them to shoot 50% from three‚Ä¶ I did not have a great shooting night and that‚Äôs a combination for disaster‚Ä¶ right the ship.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On the bench play: ‚ÄúPatrick (Baldwin, Jr.) shot the heck out of the ball‚Ä¶ loved the aggressiveness‚Ä¶ we can learn something from that‚Ä¶ continue that flow into tomorrow night.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On the defensive execution or lack thereof: ‚ÄúI agree with Steve‚Ä¶ being loud on defense‚Ä¶ we fouled too many shooters‚Ä¶ being a dog, that lies on the older guys like Draymond and myself‚Ä¶ play with more ferocity.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On the urgency: ‚ÄúWith 23 games left we still have a great opportunity‚Ä¶ play your hardest and have fun while you‚Äôre doing it‚Ä¶ I know we still have greatness‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm never gonna not believe in this team, done too many great things not to.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On the confidence level: ‚ÄúVery high, we‚Äôll give it everything we‚Äôve got‚Ä¶ give maximum effort, you can live with the results.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ Kevon Looney postgame recap: ‚ÄúWe just gotta be better‚Ä¶ played good in stretches then have a bad stretch‚Ä¶ got another one tomorrow, gotta move on.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On expecting more burst at the the break: ‚Äúhaving a couple lapses‚Ä¶ fouling at the wrong time‚Ä¶ we know what we need to do, we have the appropriate energy and the talent to win.

‚Ä¢ On the fouling issues: ‚ÄúSince I‚Äôve been here, fouling and turnovers have been the issue‚Ä¶ don‚Äôt have two of our best scorers out there‚Ä¶ more discipline‚Ä¶ gotta figure it out.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On the stretch run: ‚ÄúAs a group we know that we have a sense of urgency‚Ä¶ can‚Äôt push too hard and gamble too much‚Ä¶ can‚Äôt play hero ball.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On PBJ: ‚ÄúShowed a little bit of what he can do‚Ä¶ gonna have a long career‚Ä¶ Moses played well‚Ä¶ especially on a back to back tomorrow.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ Ty Jerome postgame recap: ‚Äúwe‚Äôre not getting stops so we have to walk the ball up the court‚Ä¶ we don‚Äôt have Steph, we don‚Äôt have Wiggs‚Ä¶ we can throw the ball into the mid-post and we don‚Äôt have that‚Ä¶ they‚Äôre a very big team‚Ä¶ AD sitting in the paint‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs tough.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On the fouling: ‚ÄúWe gotta stop reaching‚Ä¶ playing small doesn‚Äôt have anything to do with reaching‚Ä¶ cheap fouls‚Ä¶ they just look worse‚Ä¶ now we‚Äôre into the bonus in the first five minutes‚Ä¶ the refs are gonna call most fouls.

‚Ä¢ On the bench play: ‚ÄúTheir shots fell‚Ä¶ we missed some good looks‚Ä¶ credit to PBJ, Moses, those guys came in‚Ä¶ competed, played well.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On the lack of energy: ‚ÄúWe gotta stick together‚Ä¶ especially on the road.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ Steve Kerr postgame: ‚ÄúI wouldn‚Äôt compare this team to teams in the past‚Ä¶ we have to form our own identity‚Ä¶ struggling with the same issues‚Ä¶ fouling‚Ä¶ disjointed offensive possessions‚Ä¶ shot turnovers‚Ä¶ several key stretches where we had a chance‚Ä¶ couldn‚Äôt connect the game and make a run‚Ä¶ all right there for us on tape‚Ä¶ keep coaching and trying to get better.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On the key moments: ‚ÄúCut it to seven‚Ä¶ couple stretches like that in the first half‚Ä¶ cut it to three‚Ä¶ several stretches earlier than that‚Ä¶ ambitious plays offensively‚Ä¶ they had 34 free throws tonight to our 21‚Ä¶ common theme‚Ä¶ we‚Äôll try to keep coaching, keep talking to them.‚Äù

‚Ä¢ On if he expected more juice coming into the game: ‚ÄúWe got a little demoralized‚Ä¶ didn‚Äôt think we were poised enough‚Ä¶ lost that energy‚Ä¶ gotta find that quickly.‚Äù
